I wish they had a vanilla-vanilla cupcake, my benchmark for comparisons.  Next time!  The lady working there was nice, said they post daily offerings/flavors on their facebook page.
***
Day 2, I tried:
4. Vanilla cupcake with Chocolate Frosting.  Cupcake was too dry (again!), sadly. And lacked vanilla flavor, or discernable flavor. Frosting was good though.  Stick to the frosting at this kiosk...

Day 3:
Raspberry chocolate chip scone (b/c they sold out of cupcakes!).
Surprisingly scrumpdilydelicious.  Buttery, not a hockey puck.  The tangy raspberry went so well with the choc. chip.  These scones are pretty big. Full of butter, I'm sure. I felt like a lard-o after eating it, but I enjoyed it!

Day 4:
Strawberry cupcake w/cream cheese frosting.  Frosting=A. Cake=D.  Had no flavor, tasted a bit like raw dough. Sad, b/c their other cupcakes are pretty good.  Jennifer, please work on recipe!

Day 5:
Oatmeal Cherry Cookie.  Oatmeal cookie w/dried cherries.  This was ok. I ate 3/4 of the cookie before i hit the first dried cherry.  And the entire cookie only had *2* dried cherries!!!  (what?!!?) The cherries add a nice tartness.  So I just wish the cookie had more thatn two dried cherries!  Also, the flavor of the cookie reminded me of the sand angel, except with texture (oatmeal, duh).
author: Caroline I.

description: I am happy to say my office is right around the corner from the batter bakery kiosk.  Whenever I don't have time to eat breakfast at home and want good baked goods, I stop there.  For breakfast, I like their moist bread or scones.  Their caramella and shortbread cookie is to die for.  I tried a few different lavender shortbread at different bakeries but have to say batter bakery's lavender shortbread is my favorite!!!
author: Junko S.

description:
This little kiosk has turned many of my frowns upside down :-)))

I had the most perfect german chocolate cupcake from them during Valentines season and I have yet to see it again :-( Good thing they have oodles of other goodies for me to try :-)))

Mud Devil cookie
Devils Food cupcake
Lavender shortbread
Banana cupcake w/ nutella frosting

I refuse to eat anything but dark chocolate when it comes to sweets or baked goods except when I'm dealing with batter.
author: Coco M.

description:
Sometimes there are cupcake emergencies...there just are....sometimes its 2 pm and your computer crashes and candidates are crying and clients are yelling and I say to myself..."this is a cupcake emergency". 

Batter Bakery has strategically placed their kiosk on California street for such times...however there should be a little sign outside that says: 

"in case of emergency, DO NOT Break the glass" 

Sometimes they are out of your favorite flavors ( I mean there is not a lot of room in there!) but you always manage to find something great- Red Velvet, Carrot Cake, Sand Angels all amazing and home made-like...I also like that your one little cupcake comes in a cute batter box. 

So...the next time you have a cupcake emergency I suggest you run like heck to Batter and eat your emotions. 

Bring your cash- $5 should do you.
author: Sarah M.

description:
High quality. Delicious. Friendly Staff. Easily accessible by BART. 

Ate the Peanut-Butter Cup Cookies, Devil's Food Brownie, and Carrot Cupcake. The PB cookies were super savory. The brownie was soft and rich. The cupcake was fruitier than most cupcakes and pleasingly moist; a nice change from many other cupcakes in the city.

Plus, it's situated at the bottom of the hill leading up to the Fairmont Hotel that you can jog, walk up afterwards to work off a handful of those satisfying calories.
author: Sharand N.

description:
An amazing little gem of sweet yummy goodness!

Their chocolate peanut butter cupcakes are the best I've had. A deep dark chocolate cupcake frosted with creamy peanut butter whipped topping, which is velvety smooth and doesn't have a hint of any granulated sugar crunchiness. Top that off with a mini peanut butter cup and you have the most divine snack ever. It's a good thing they don't have them every day because I'd be broke buying my stash. I am practically salivating just thinking about them now.
author: Lori M.

description: Me and the hubby were out in San Fran for an appt and what do you know. There's a kiosk selling cookies. I had to stop to see if I spotted anything interesting because I am always on the lookout for a perfect cookie, a soft yet chewy center with just the right amount of crispness on the outside. And I found just that. I went with a peanut butter and he got the sand angel and let me tell you, they were both delicious. I will definitely be buying again as soon as I am in the area. That is if I don't give in to ordering online before that.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Batter Bakery now offers breakfast, and not just baked goods, but also parfaits. A more accurate description would be a parfait bar, as you can mix and match between house granola, house dried fruit and skyr. What's that, you ask? It's a thick yogurt from Iceland (http://www.skyr.com/), And it's amazing. Nonfat, all natural, no artificial anything. Agave syrup as a sweetner. High in protein. Delicious.

I went all in and got everything. You should do the same.
author: Jason B.

description:
This little kiosk at the corner of California and Kearny is adorable!  It's hard to miss and is literally at the corner in front of the huge B of A building.    

I've tried their cupcakes, which are okay.  I've had better.  Their cookies, however, are to die.  My favorite cookie used to be from Specialty's (I'm sure you know which one).  But, now it has been replaced by the most amazing Peanut Butter Blossoms.  OMG.  I can literally eat an entire bag in one sitting.  It's something that I crave every week.  I've also tried their shortbread cookies, which are really good.  One in particular, the Lavender Sea Salt Shortbread Cookies, is a great mix of salty sweet.  I like the balance of the two flavors.  Some may not agree, especially if the taste/smell of Lavender is not so appealing to you.  But, I don't think it's too overpowering, so I enjoy it.  With the subtle sprinkling of sea salt on top.  It's another win for Battery Bakery.  I can't wait to try the rest of their baked goods.  

They accept CC.  Being a little kiosk there is only one person manning the place.  So, you may find it is temporarily closed for a short while during the day.  But, don't fret.  Just check the note they leave as to what time they'll be back.  Check their website out for more on their goods of the day and follow them on Twitter @batterbakery.  Always a pleasant experience when I'm there.
author: Heizel M.

description:
It's more like a 3.5 rating! I am only reviewing the cupcakes! I purchased a dozen of cupcakes for a company birthday function for $33. You get $0.25 off each cupcake when you order a dozen so instead of $3 each it was $2.75 each. 

The flavors we ordered and requested:
Devil's Food Cupcakes with Vanilla Frosting-average, nothing special
Vanilla Cupcakes with Chocolate Frosting-the vanilla cupcake base was a little dry
Red Velvet Cupcakes-the cupcake ingredients were not mixed well and when I bit into it, I could feel little chucks! 

The cupcakes here are very similar to Miette's cupcake using light soft buttercream frosting instead of a sugary hard frosting so on a hot day it'll probably melt before you get back to work! I tend to like the harder frosting! 
For $3 a pop, they can make it a little bigger, it is definitely way way too expensive for a cupcake this size but what do you expect? It's in FIDI!!
author: Leeseuh K.

description:
I had the pleasure of meeting Jen recently at a booth she had going at the Boss of Sauce event where she was sampling some of her interesting flavored cookies. We ended up buying three kinds because they were all so delicious! 

We bought the Sea Salt Lavender shortbread cookies which were buttery shortbread squares with bits of lavender baked in and flecks of sea salt sprinkled on the top, the Amaretto drops which were chewy and perfectly sweet and Rosemary Biscotti. I can't say much about the Rosemary Biscotti because my piggy boyfriend ate them all before I could have any, but the sample I did try at the event was  great.  They were sweet and savory with that yummy woody and herbaceous smell and taste Rosemary has.
author: Dee I.

description:
This is my favorite place for cupcake!!!!!!

I have tried their red velvet, vanilla and peanut butter cupcakes and all of them are very yummy.  Their cupcakes are small and individually placed inside a cardboard box.  It its not too filling and sweet and it is just perfect. Cupcake lovers really need to try this place!

For cookies I like their chocolate chip, mud devils and sand angels which is kind of like snicker doodle.  Peanut Butter Blossoms are also must try if you are a peanut butter fan!
author: Kuankii N.

description:
Wow.  After reading reviews by my fellow "yelpers", I decided to give this place a try.  My intention was to go there and get a cupcake, but after talking to the girl who was working there, I left with a cookie.  I am a very happy customer!  The cookie, which was a generous size, was called a Sand Angel.  A little like a snickerdoodle with cinnamon and a chewy texture.  Very good!  I will be going back from time to time to sample more goodies!

For Valentines day, they have a kiosk open inside 555 California, but just for the holiday.

I say it's worth the trip!  Even better if you work close by like me!

Enjoy!
author: Shannon S.

description: Absolutely delicious cookies. I got the sand angel cookie and it completely rocked my world. It was sweet, soft, and extremely tasty. The cookie was also pretty big (roughly the size of 3/4 of my hand) and came in some nice packaging. Definitely showed that the lady running the place cared about her customers. If my office was a bit closer I would go at least twice, maybe even three times a week.
author: Dennis R.

description:
I work across the street and I always would see this tiny kiosk with a line in the morning and afternoon.  Whenever I see a line I think what could I possibly be missing??  Finally on my way back from lunch one sunny afternoon last week I tried Batter.  The kiosk is filled with everything yummy and especially good after you have had some rockin curry.

Cookies, cupcakes and brownies oh my!!  What to pick, what to pick.  The line was fortunately only two deep when I arrived so after patiently waiting it was my turn.  I choose the Fudge Brownie and then bought a bag (5) of small sugar cookies with a peanut butter cup in the middle (sooo yummy)!!!  The prices were a bit steep which is why I have to give this cute little spot in FiDi 4 stars. But try this place if you are in the area and craving something sweet in the morning or afternoon!  

Next on my list is to try their breads which I have heard are heavenly in the morning.  See you soon Batter!!
author: Heidi S.

description: The Lavender Sea Salt shortbread cookies are pretty freakin' sweet. Actually they're also savory, but you know what I mean. Crisp, buttery, with the sea salt giving it a savory flavorful twist. Smart choice from the Saison team to serve them as mignardises post meal. Now I'm only guessing here but, Batter's Friandise kiosk is gonna go gangbusters when they open
author: Kim N.

description:
My roomie works right by this little kiosk, and we now have a new weekly tradition: cupcakes from Batter post-lunch.

For a tiny booth, Batter sure has a lot of options. So far I've tried:

- red velvet cupcake - SO good. SO moist.
- lavender sea salt shortbread - good if you like floral in your food. My coworkers were big fans but my roommate made a face and said it tasted like aromatherapy in her mouth. There are straight up lavender kernels in the cookies, so the flavor is quite strong.
- chocolate cupcake with espresso frosting - the cake part was good, but the frosting had the consistency of congealed oil...avoiding this one from now on.

The baked goods are a little pricey ($3 for a cupcake), but I'm willing to spend that on a sweet, weekly indulgence.
author: Lisa W.

description:
PEANUT BUTTER CUPCAKEE!! I love peanut butter .. whether its in a cookie, a sandwich, yogurt, ice cream or cupcakes. So its fair to say I have some expertise when it comes to peanut butter. If you are a fan of peanut butter .. you will not be disappointed.  I should note that I left my cupcakes in the fridge overnight .. so you would think its not as tasty but it was DELICIOUS!!!!!! The perfect amount of frosting, moist, and just right!  The chocolate cupcake was pretty good not as moist, but the frosting was tasty. I didn't care too much for the confetti cupcake. It was my least favorite of the four cupcakes. The red velvet was amazingggg!! The perfect combination of cupcake and frosting ratio. I could go for another one right now. 

My biggest disappointment here is the packaging. I do think the little individual boxes are super cute but not very eco friendly. I hope the store considers bigger boxes for larger orders.
author: Jen P.

description: I was craving cupcakes and found this place through yelp. It's TINY! but they a wide selection of sweets to choose from. The sales girl was very helpful. We got the red velvet cupcake, vanilla cupcake, and lavender sea salt shortbread. The cupcakes were a bit dry and the frosting more watery than I like. The shortbread was really good.
author: Linda C.

description:
I was able to try a few samples in the mezzanine area of our building the other day. Whatever I ate, it was good! 

They then opened in the small kiosk outside my building where the old flower stand used to be. I couldn't resist picking something up yesterday, even though I had already eaten my second breakfast. (No, I'm not a hobbit. I'm pregnant and I eat 2 breakfasts, ok? Don't judge!) 
I picked up the lemon almond scone. So lemony, with almond flakes. Not dry at all! 

My husband saw my twitter feed regarding the consumption of my 3rd breakfast, this lemon almond scone. He begged me to go pick him up something. So, I picked up the sour cream coffee cake for him. He loved it! 

This place is going to be dangerous for me. I'm really trying to tone down my weight gain during this pregnancy (I've gained 43 pounds already). But it's going to be hard walking by Batter's kiosk every morning!
author: Caroline C.

description: A cute little kiosk that sells cupcakes, cookies, and other baked goods. The shortbread is just okay, but I appreciate that they have interesting flavor combinations like lavendar sea salt, rosemary brown butter, and sesame ginger. I prefer the other cookies which I think taste better, have a great consistency, and are a good portion size.
author: Alice J.

description:
Very cute little kiosk with an obviously limited but very good selection of baked good.  Staff was super nice to boot.  

I had the Mango bread which was a pleasure but a touch too buttery.  They also gave me half a peanut butter chocolate chip cookie as gift - hmm, hmm, hmm.  Guess I just had my lunch.

Wish they served coffee and this would be a terrific breakfast spot on my way to work.
author: David A.

description:
I am not sure why there are bad reviews about the baked goods, but I LOVE this place.  I ordered a couple of items to make sure that I got a good smattering of baked goods to try. 

I first had a taste of the free Sand Angel Cookie (it apparently was free with purchase that day).  I did not get to eat the entire thing because I gave it to my husband to eat - he thought it was ok, but I thought it was great!  I am not really a cookie person, but I really like it.

I opted to try the red velvet cupcake - Oh my god - that cupcake was moist and the cream cheese frosting was amazing.  I am a big fan of Sprinkle cupcakes and I do love them, but the cupcake from Batter Bakery was much better.  The cream cheese frosting was the perfect sweetness and the red velvet cake was moist and just sweet enough.  It was perfect!  I was sad when I finished it because I should have gotten more.  Next time I have a party and want cupcakes I am definately pre-ordering them from this place.  I can't wait to go back and try other flavors.

Next thing I tried was the devil's food brownie.  I tried to share with my husband, but it was too yummy.  It was the perfect brownie, not too cakey and not too fudgy, but just right.  I love love love it!

And now I have just tried the lavendar sea salt short bread cookies. Yummy - it is the perfect blend of sweet and savory saltiness.  I think it is the perfect cookie to have with a nice cup of chammomile tea.

I am so glad that I bike commute to work because with that place downtown it is hard to resist just a little treat for the the afternoon.  I highly recommend this place if you get a chance to pick a sweet.  I can't wait to go back and try some more items.
author: Janelle W.

description: I tried their yogurt with dried fruit and granola (you can add on each) ... and it was SO GOOD!!! You may ask, a yogurt parfait is a yogurt parfait....but this one was one of the best yogurt parfaits I've had. First off, they use Siggi's yogurt and it's thick and creamy and ... LOW SUGAR! I LOVED it so much that I went to Whole Foods soon after to buy my own (and now they're residing in my fridge.) Their granola is really tasty with bits of coconut shreds. I like how it's not the gooey kind of granola but the dry, toasty ones. You can choose what combination of dried fruits you want.
author: Grace C.

description:
I read yelps about this place and had to try it. 

I walked the 2 blocks to find what looked like a glass newspaper stand filled with baked goods. I've driven past this kiosk before and never really noticed that it was a bake stand. 

The girl working there was nice and offered me a sample of their Chocolate Cinnamon Cream cheese cupcake. Cupcakes are dense and frosting is gooey just how i like it! 

I read that their Sand Angels were delicious and I'm one of those taste it before I believe it gals. Boy was it delicious. I can only describe it as a light ginger spiced butter cookie. YUMMY 

I also purchased a red velvet as they my favorite cupcake. I will edit this page after I've eaten it; I'm so full after that Sand Angel!
author: J-nine I.

description:
this review of 5 stars is solely based on their salted lemon cookies(shortbreads?) 
SO GOOD.  i don't even like cookies, and i ate one after another(and another) when someone brought a box of these into the office.

they're buttery but light, if that makes sense.  with the perfect balance of sweet & salty.  think i'm going to walk over and have another one!
 :)
author: kristina h.

description:
I have had better Chocolate chip cookies, it had a weird clove smell that my mom and I noticed. But it still tasted good which is suprising because I hate cloves. I love that nothing is too sweet.
I loved the blackberry hazelnut bread, it was delicious! So moist and it was around  
3:00 so I expected less but I will for sure be coming back. Good job guys and great location. ;) only a block away from school.
author: Courtney M.

description: They've opened up a pop-up in 2 Embarcadero Center for the upcoming holidays.  I needed an afternoon pick me up and decided to check out their offerings.  I am currently enjoying a Sand Angel cookie.  Oh. My. Gravy.  It is buttery, chewy and tasty.  Very pleased right now.
author: Jovanie C.

description:
I just tried cupcakes (devils food, vanilla w/ cinamon buttercream, and pumpkin) and a lavendar sea salt cookie from Batter Bakery and thought they were quite tasty.  I ordered the cupcakes over the phone and found the customer service woman who helped me to be quite pleasant. 

The frosting on the cupcakes was very light tasting, even on the devils food cupcake.  If you are looking for richness it would not be the cupcake place for you, but if you prefer a light frosting that's not overly sugary this is the place for you. The price at $2.75 per cupcake is reasonable - as far as specialty cupcakes in the city go. Unfortunatly I was only able to get three flavors in my order of 10 cupcakes, but this is a step up from some who only allow one flavor per dozen.  I find the flavors to also be limited but it is a small stand, so this is not unexpected.

The cookie was good, but the cupcakes were better.  The lavendar component of the cookie wasn't offensive, but it'd presence made the cookie unbalanced to me. It would be more of a home run if it just had the sea salt - which was a great unexpected addition to the hard savory sugar cookie. 

I'll definitely be back to try more, and am hoping they open a larger store front nearby.
author: Erica L.

description: overpriced, nothing special..  the mornig pastries are typically dried out.  i keep telling myself do not go back and after buying a crazy priced pumpkin sugar cookie on halloween, i will not.  everything on the chalboard sounds delicious, but youd be better off without.
author: John G.

description:
I  loved working with Jen Musty for my wedding. She not only was a pleasure to work with but very easy going with great suggestions on how to stay within our budget but also allowing us to be creative. She gave me the best deal of any bakery in the city for our wedding cupcakes and for the delivery. Also, at the last minute she let me order more cupcakes since we ended up inviting more people last minute to our wedding. Now the cupcakes were absolutely divine! Not too sugary (which is a BIG pet peeve of mine when it comes to frosting) and very smooth and velvety! I wanted to eat the entire box that showed up with "congratulations!" on it while I was getting ready. 
Thanks again Jen!
author: Christina R.

description: I can only base my review on the Devil's Food Brownie.. my mouth is watering as I type this.  I absolutely love chocolate and this brownie satisfies my craving.  The texture is more gooey than cakey and I love it.  After you take a bite, it almost looks like it will melt.  The cost ($3) is probably equivalent to a boxed brownie mix that yields a lot more than one brownie; but you won't get the same amazing taste.  Please note that this location is just the kiosk--the main location is on Polk Street.
author: Doreen M.

description:
Newsstand-styled kiosk bakery that cures chocolate cravings. Best fudge brownies.

I've been here twice and am combining my reviews into one.

ORDER:
Devil's Food Brownie
$3
This is smallish brownie wrapped in brown waxed paper. Despite its size, it's packed with the most fudge-like chocolate richness I've ever tasted in a brownie. This is definitely perfect for the brownie batter lover. It's incredibly moist and melts in your mouth. Yummmmm! It is very rich, so you may consider sharing it with a friend or savouring it across a couple snack breaks.

Mint chocolate cookie
$2.75
This is a good-sized chocolate cookie that has a nice touch of mint taste. The cookie is reasonably thick, so the inside is soft and chewy, while the outside is crispy.

AMBIENCE: The kiosk is a cylindrical location reminiscent of a news stand.

SERVICE: Fine.

VISIT DETAILS: Afternoon chocolate-with-carbs fix.
author: C L.

description:
Red Velvet cupcakes. Buy 4 and stuff them in your face immediately.

They're moist and light and the frosting is thick and sweet but not too heavy. Perfect ratio of frosting to cake and they come in little individual branded boxes. I dig it. You will too. Go stuff.
author: Jarrod B.

description:
Scrumptious treats. They have the best strawberry cupcakes I have ever had. Its a small delectable portion, tasty strawberry flavored cream cheese frosting.
Their cookies are a bit too dense for my taste.
author: Soumeya B.

description: Satisfying cupcakes and goodies in the financial district.  I like Batter over Cupcake Cove.  Better & cuter cupcakes (my fave are the red velvets) and a much larger variety of sweets.  The lavender & sea salt shortbread is unique and surprisingly good (I thought it would taste like a spa).
author: A C.

description:
I was very skeptical about buying cupcakes from a flower booth... I felt so bad for the poor girl sitting inside too.  But when I went in and ordered one red velvet cupcake ($3), she handed me the smallest, cutest box ever!  Just enough to fit one cupcake. 

It was actually for my boyfriend and he LOVED it!  Top 3 in the city (his words, not mines).  I also thought they were pretty good too.
author: Y L.

description: OMG the lavender sea salt shortbread cookies are to die for!
author: Sharon E.

description:
well hello there, mister pb chocolate chip cookie.  and now, goodbye.  pb chocolate chip cookie was delicious - i ate the whole thing even though i meant to only eat half.  and you know how some pb cookies leave you with greasy fingers?  this one does not.  oh, the little things.

on a previous visit, i had the confetti vanilla cupcake with chocolate buttercream.  the cupcake was the perfect size for an after-lunch dessert but i couldn't get over how good it was, so i obviously wanted more. i'm really glad this place is an uphill walk (sort of) for me - because even if my willpower is sucking that day, at least i'll have to work for it. 

what would make this a 5-star kiosk is if they served a strong brew of coffee to go with their sweet, sweet goodies.
author: Lisa C.

description: yummy treats... cookies, cupcakes, brownies etc.  Cute packaging too if you are looking for a nice treat/gift for someone.
author: Robyn B.

description:
Tried Batter Bakery after a third failed attempt with Sibby's. 

The BEST cupcakes we've ordered - they actually taste homemade.  Delivery was on time, the cupcakes looked great and I got rave reviews from my team

I do a lot of corporate catering events, including monthly birthday celebrations.  Ive used Kara's, Sibby's AND Miettes.  Batter Bakery has been the best by far.

Jen (the owner) answers her own calls, emails and does her own deliveries.  Although German Chocolate Cupcakes are not on her regular menu, she happily made them for my team.  They flew out of the box.  She said she'd happily try to fill any special request.

The carrot cupcakes had chunks of nuts, moist shreds of carrots, and the frosting tasted homemade.

If you are looking to upgrade, try Batter Bakery.
author: Fräulein J.

description:
A charming botique bakery based in the Mission District out of the Stable Cafe on Folsom St. A Batter Bakery kiosk is soon to open in the Financial District downtime. They use premium, fresh ingredients and offer unique products, such as the Lavender Sea Salt Shortbread. They offer catering -- typically with private and corporate clients -- and batter orders for at-home baking enjoyment. Among their clients is Fraiche Yogurt; their popular granola and chocolate chip cookies are Batter Bakery products. 

Where: Batter Kiosk at 555 California Ave (California and Kearney), Stable Cafe, Fraiche Yogurt, Blue Fog Market, Dolores Cafe, Trouble Cafe, I dunno where else.

What I've tried: brownie, peanut butter chocolate chip cookie, chocolate chip cookie, sand angel cookie, sea salt lavender shortbread, coffee cake, blueberry muffin, carrot muffin, cinnamon shortbread, pineapple zucchini bread, chocolate chip banana bread, lemon almond scone, cherry pecan scone. 

Experience: Every item has been a treat, but I have a serious affection for baked goods. The brownie is moist, airy, and rich with quality chocolate. The sand angel is thick, perfectly round, and a unique homemade blend that reminds me of gingerbread, graham, and snickerdoodle. The peanut butter choc. chip cookie is one of my favorite items, which is surprising because I'm not usually a fan of peanut butter cookies. These aren't overly nutty, sugary, or salty. I'd note that no Batter item I've tried has tasted too sugary or dry, which is a nice break from overly-sugared muffins and brownies.
 
In all, I always look forward to tasting their products and I doubt you'll be disappointed with any Batter Bakery item.
author: Heath P.

description: These treats also make a nice gift for your loved ones (including yourself) ~ go on, you deserve it.
author: Cathy K.

description: The chocolate shortbread cookie from a coffeeshop is all I've tried so far. Good, but nothing amazing. Perhaps I'll revise this after I've tried their other options...
author: Kimberley D.

description: Carmelita bars are fantastic!!!!! Cupcakes are great too.  Here is how I like to eat a cupcake:  Tear the bottom half off, put it on top of frosting, press into a sandwich.  Eat!!  Perfect cake to frosting ratio every bite and you can bite into the whole thing.
author: Wakako U.

description: I love these cookies. I always get the peanut butter blossoms (amazing!!) and different short bread. Who knew lavender and sea salt make delicious cookies? Now I know! I can't wait to try try the rest.
author: Tracy B.

description:
Picked up a blueberry muffin in the afternoon the other day as I had been hearing great things about the kiosk opening. Even the foodie in my office was raving about it.

My muffin was okay. It wasn't bad or anything, just not to the taste of what I like. I don't know if it was just this muffin as I haven't tried anything else or if things taste better in the morning when they first open. 

Am glad someone is putting the old flower stand to good use though.
author: Janice O.

description:
This 5 star rating is for the brownies. SO GOOD. Very fudgy and rich and soft and moist. So delicious. 

This place is just a little covered stand on the corner of kearny and california, but they do take credit cards! 

I'd also give their oatmeal cherry cookie 4 stars, and the chocolate chip cookies 3 stars. Now though that I've figured out their best product, I won't be trying anything else.
author: Caitlin B.

description:
i was craving something sweet when i passed by the kiosk. decided to take a look. the girl working inside recommended the sand angel which is like a snickerdoodle. it was delicious!! crispy edges and chewy inside! i love how it wasn't too sweet or buttery like specialty's. it was just right. they also offer cupcakes, shortbreads, muffins, and various breads. yum yum in my tum!! this is going to be dangerous since i work right across the street...kinda skurred.

update: chocolate mint cookies are good too, but the red velvet cupcake was a disappointment. A bit dry and plain...definitely not worth the $3...
author: Tiffany T.

description: Fantastic kiosk in the middle of the financial district.  Warm cookies and terrific scones for breakfast.  The cherry pecan scone along with the current / lemon scones are a hit.  You can't go wrong stopping by for a quick morning or afternoon treat.
author: Jennifer O.

description: This little stand makes me think of Superman and his telephone booth. I go in tired, broken down by the banalities of work and come out energized and high off of that failproof combo of sugar, butter and combo.  The chocolate chip cookies are dense, chewy, melty and buttery.  I swear there's also a hint of banana in there. Eat one and I promise you, your outlook on life will improve.
author: Dianna W.

description: Sand Angel Cookie: I like that the cookie is soft, but it's kind of pricey ($2.50) and it just tastes normal to me. Doesn't "wow" me.
author: Vera W.

description:
Sometimes, one cannot fight temptations.

Although I watch what I eat, I sometimes can't fight the temptation to eat something sweet (this happens probably about once every few weeks).  This is when Batter Bakery comes in to play.   It's so conveniently close to work, it could be dangerous for those with a serious sweet tooth.  My favorite item is the lavender sea salt short bread.  The combination of savory and sweet is perfect...neither flavor is over-powering.  Next are the mini cupcakes.  The pumpkin is mmm mmm good...the cupcake is soft and moist, and the cream cheese frosting is ooooey gooey goodness.  The red velvet cupcake is a bit on the dry side, but I do love the cream cheese frosting again.  The brownies are really rich...I can only handle eating about a 1/4 of it.  Their signature cookie is the sandbar and the ingredients are supposed to be a secret.  I just picked up one of these today and will have to update my review once I get a taste of it.
author: Michelle N.

description: Awesome cookies.  I bought a dozen cookies, two dozens biscuits, and half a dozen brownies for admin appreciation day - the ladies all loved them.
author: Lisa L.

description: 4.5 stars if i could because this was the best chocolate chip cookie ive ever had....but they're pricey....and they don't have much of a selection of goodies....but the chocolate chip cookie is drool inducing
author: H K.

description: YUM!! Anything I've ever had from here is sooo good! Especially the peanut butter blossom cookie. Man that cookie is totally worth the extra 25 min on the treadmill. It makes me happy :)
author: lindsay f.

description: OOOhhhh-em-Gee! Who needs a man when you've got a polka dot cookie?  Orgasmic. Seriously.
author: Rebecca S.

description: Just ate a chocolate/peanut butter cupcake with a peanut butter cup on top and wow!  Not sicky sweet and the chocolate cake is perfectly moist.  Quite the cool little kiosk.
author: Corey V.

description: Bought a piece of lemon bread for breakfast. Very disappointed. The bread tasted cold, refrigerated cold. The cake was a little hard and not moisted like their other pastries. Tasted like yesterday's goods.
author: susan g.

description: Goodness gracious... CHOCOLATE CHIP BANANA BREAD!!!
author: Maximillian M.

description: AAAUUUUGGGHHHH oohhh goddddddd i just walked ten miles per hour over to the Batter kiosk before no one would notice i was gone at work, bought a sand angel cookie and a carmelita and ate them both within about 5-7 minutes while walking as fast as possible. not a good idea, but i love it when you're eating a delicious, sweet, creamy cookie and all of a sudden you get that faint taste of salt that makes your mouth water and everything even more delicious than it was a nano-second ago. time to go to the gym.
author: Laura M.

description: 2.5 stars. I've only had the sand angel, the lavendar shortbread, and the chocolate chip cookie, but I think they put too much salt in their cookies. I'm a bigger fan of moist baked goods and this place is a little dry; I want to dip it in coffee or tea! Its a cute little kiosk on the corner. Cookies run around $2.50. I definitely wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but its pretty convenient location for a sugar fix if you work in the area.
author: Julia L.

description: Carmelita Bar: Delicious. Pretty much tastes like butter mixed with sugar and some toppings, which is to say it's delicious and homemade. I could list the ingredients just by the taste, which is awesome.
author: Jeff N.

description:
We were visiting SF a couple of weeks ago and decided to order a "breakfast basket"  from Batter Bakery so we could have a picnic brunch at the rooftop of our hotel (Hotel Vitale)  with a view of the Bay Bridge, 
Waterfront, and Embarcadero.

The breakfast basket was absolutely fantastic!!!  All our bakery goodies came in a cute wicker basket.  We were carrying the basket to our hotel and on the way, we received many compliments on how cute the basket was.  The basket came with an huge assortment of bite size cookies (yum!), a little loaf of coffee cake, a bag of homemade granola, a quiche for two, a bag of delicious dates, two oranges, and an assortment of 4 or 5 scones and 2 slices of coffee cake.  It was enough food to last us for a couple of mornings.  The bakery items were absolutely delicious.   Everything was so well prepared.  It was a really nice treat for our special visit to SF.
author: Happy M.

description: Yum. I just had a honey vanilla shortbread cookie as a little lunchtime treat. Great little kiosk in a convenient location. Kind of difficult to see the selection of baked goods from the street level as it's kind of high up (or maybe I'm short). Not too friendly either, but the cookie was really good. Not too sweet, not too buttery, just right.
author: Amy C.

description: Next door to my job, I'm addicted :) AMAZING Cupcakes!!! Sweet-creamy frosting, yummy:):)
author: Christie S.

description: Tried their cookies which were yum and a vanilla sprinkle cupcake which was Meh. I do love that there is a kiosk...
author: C D.

description: We used them to cater our Halloween Party and ordered a few dozen of the mini cupcakes with Halloween decorations on them, they were not only yummy but so cute!  We were a little last minute on ordering and most bakeries around town could not squeeze our order in but Batter Bakery is my savior!  The staff who answered was very friendly and accommodating.  The mini vanilla cupcakes had little black, orange, and white sprinkles,, they also used chocolate and sprinkles to make spiders, frosting to make a ghost, etc. They were adorable! They were a hit at our office party with the employees and their kids! I will be sure to use Batter Bakery again, as well as to recommend them to anyone in the area. Thanks Batter Bakery!
author: Tracy N.

description: Yum yum yum. The batter kiosk is 1.5 blocks from where I work and I can't even tell you how happy that makes me.  The chocolate brownies and choc. chip cookies are there to satisfy my afternoon cravings. But don't go too late because they run out of the goods pretty quickly!
author: Janice Y.

description: The cupcakes are a bit small for what you pay for. I had the red velvet which was nice and moist. The frosting wasn't too sweet either. The chocolate with cinnamon frosting on the other hand was quite dry. If you opt to try just one thing from this place I say go with the Sand Angel.
author: t s.

description:
Batter Bakery is located on a corner of the BofA building in the financial district.  I'm very happy that they came to the financial district because there has been a severe lack of good cookies/cupcakes in this area (there are a few but it's a little bit of a walk)

Square footage: I would venture guess that it's less than 20.

Cookies:  their flagship cookies the sand angel and deservingly so.  I would also say any of their shortbread cookies are awesome.  

Bars:  not a huge fan of their 5-layer bar. it's just too complex of a flavor and so nothing really stands out. what stands out is how sweet it is.

Cupcakes:  red velvet is top notch.  all others are decent but nothing to write home about. not a huge fan of the german chocogate cupcake

Overall: the desserts are great and the people are friendly but their credit card machine is the slowest machine this side of the mississippi.  if you're in the area, try it out but don't do out of your way (don't walk 20 minutes to go here) to try it out.
author: Paul C.

description: got the lavendar short bread!! every last crumb was as good as it gets!! i wish i had gotten more, it was delicious! i also had the chocolate mint cookie, very chocolatey and minty.........YUM! i am a happy camper!
author: Stella J.

description: the mango bread is moist and delectable!!!  per wakako's suggestion, i also got the carmelita bar, which is huge and hefty.  i have yet to try it, so i'll update this review when i do.
author: Helen T.

description: So expensive... but I kept coming back for more and introducing it to all my friends. I'd say the shortbread is definitely the highlight here, and I've tried the lavender sea salt (which is the only thing you need to buy here if you're on a tight budget), and the rosemary brown butter. Their sand angels aren't bad either. I have to say a large part of the appeal of Batter was the adorable glass kiosk it's housed in. Just walking into that broom closet-sized space to buy something is an act that somehow carries its own charm.
author: Angela X.

description: Meh...I've experienced better.
author: Jenna K.

description:
This place is across the street from my office. It's the type of place that people might not give a chance, but that would be a mistake. I just ate their chocolate brownie, and I have to say I almost crapped my pants it was so delicious. I could eat 8 more of them, right now. I have eaten their chocolate chip cookies before, and also very delicious.
If you are looking for a quick sweet in the area, I highly recommend this place!
author: Joel R.

description: Wrote a review for BB about 2 years ago and had to write another. First of OMG the cinnamon shortbread and the peanut butter chocolate cupcakes are to die for. These are now my personal favorites. I also love the fact that BB not only does cupcakes but cookes and bars. I order for monthly b-day celebration at work and I like the fact that I can use them every time and get a great variety of yummy goodness is great.
author: Alana R.

description: This place has been great! I have a muffin at least once a week. The variety has been awesome. The scones are good too, I personally like scones dry, but these are very buttery. They taste like dessert rather than a breakfast snack with my coffee. The cookies are great, and I love the cupcakes as well. This has been a great addition to my morning commute!
author: Jaime C.

description: from gilt city, i got the mixing bowl assortment of goodies...i was going to use it for some occasion, but of course, the expiration date crept up on me. within the mix, my favorite thing was the sea salt lavender shortbread and sand angel cookie. i think the quality is good and the kiosk is cute. i may come by again...
author: Marjie T.

description:
Love the cupcakes from Batter - especially that lemon-deeelish. The sponge has the perfect consistency and the frosting is light and flavorful but with just enough richness that you are in for a real treat.

To top it off, Jen is a joy to work with. She is passionate, generous and really customer service oriented. Delivery in the City is affordable and always on time which is a huge help.
author: Kristin N.

description:
EVERYTHING here is delicious.

One of the best cookies I have ever had in my life is the infamous Sand Angel.

Love it!
author: Kelli S.

description: Now, I bake a lot at home, so I'm picky about things when I'm out. But I willingly walk the blocks from work to the Batter kiosk to get an afternoon cookie. Peanut butter chocolate chip is my favorite so far, and I also love their loaf cakes available at Stable Cafe. Items are always incredibly fresh, too!
author: Jess Z.

description: Holy chocolatey amazingness!!!!!  This bakery bakes the BEST everything I have ever had in my life.  I am currently eating one of the devil's food brownies and I might pass out because it is so good.  You must try this place.  You can get their baked goods at Stable on 17th and Folsom....which is also one of my favorite places in the world.
author: Michelle N.

description:
This place is awesome!  I ordered a variety of cupcakes for my Manager's birthday celebration, and they were able to take the order only a day before and they let me order other flavors that weren't going to be on the menu the next day.  Each flavor was super delicious!  Seriously!  They won't disappoint!

Great customer service and delicious desserts are always a good thing!  Btw...absolutely genius that this place is a kiosk!  Very convenient!

I will definitely order from them at every birthday we have since they have a great selection!  I crave the red velvet...yum-o! o!
author: J D.

description: I love the lavender shortbread - they are amazing. This is not going to be good for the waistline but so amazing for the tastebuds.
author: Cbr A.

description: Expensive for what you get. Some times things are dry. I wasnt that impressed, I would rather have something from Specialties.
author: Vanessa N.

description: not a ton of variety but for a little claustrophobic stand in the middle of the street, you can't ask for much. good cookies but i won't actively try to find my way back any time soon.
author: Regina C.

description:
Jen has been providing the baked goods for my store for about a year. Through all that time, I've begged her to start a catering business (and happily, she finally has).
I can say with 100% confidence that she is the most talented baker I've ever met. Every single thing she bakes is better than any other baked good I've tried.
She makes everything by hand and uses only the highest quality ingredients (madagascar vanilla, etc).
She actually specializes in things like muffins, quickbreads and other morning items, so I would highly recommend her for morning meetings.
If I could give her 10 stars, I would :)
author: Jessica G.

description: I just finished the most scrumptious cupcake from Batter Bakery - chocolate with peanut butter frosting.  I am a baker and a bit of a stickler for quality cupcakes.  This was the real thing.  Perfect balance of creamy, slightly salty peanut butter frosting to moist (but not faux-boxed cake mix moist) chocolate cake.  The frosting to cake ratio and texture is just right, not like Kara's where at times you have a slightly dry cake texture below a giant mound of hard and overly sweet frosting (don't get me wrong, I still like Kara's when in the Marina.)  This cupcake takes the cake, though - literally.  Best I've had in SF so far.  I have also had some of the cookies, the brownie, and the lavendar and sea salt shortbread.  I like these but the cupcake is the standout for me.
author: Molly V.

description: Just tried their red velvet cupcake and it was delicious. The frosting was lighter and more airy than most cream cheese frosting I've had. The actual cake was a little dry but again, not heavy or overly buttery tasting. Oh, and the two girls that worked there were hot! Cute girls and baked goods... what more can you ask for?
author: Salil A.

description: I've heard their baked goods are great, but hope that on the new version of the website they -have the correct phone number -explain they don't have a storefront and the location of the cafe that stocks their goods on Folsom.
author: KD D.

description: I was fortunate to be invited to the bakery opening in June where I got to taste Jen's Sand Angels.  My friend's description of the cookies sums it up: "They're like crack.  You can't stop."  Shortbread was delicious, too - love the herb and sea salt combinations.
author: Andrea S.

description:
best scone in sf, by a long shot.  

You can also get them at the Blue Fog Markets ( Divisadero & California, Gough and Green), but, if you got to Stable on Folsom they're fresh.
author: kate S.

description: Tried Batter Bakery goods at the Coffee shop - STABLE.  She is the most talented baker I've come across in a while.  Quality of the ingredients is top notch.  She does interesting flavor combinations as well as straight ahead breakfast breads etc.  Am eating the pumpkin bread - crumb is fine and so moist you wonder how she accomplished.
author: kelly i.
